info.title: NetDocuments
info.description: NetDocuments is a cloud content management service for businesses of all sizes to securely create, store, manage and share their document work anywhere, anytime.

scopes.organize: create folders, file to folders, change acls or profile, etc

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The user ID assigned by NetDocuments.

put.summary: Create a new version of a document
put.description: Create new version of a document

parameters.name: extension
parameters.description: Do not include the leading period.

parameters.name: official
parameters.description: The new version will not be the official version if this parameter is not set.

parameters.name: srcVer
parameters.description: If copying the content from a prior version, which version of the document to copy.

parameters.name: allocatesubversion
parameters.description: Create as a subversion instead of as a full version.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The content of the new version, if not copying another version or the official version.

parameters.name: permanent
parameters.description: Indicates that the document should be permanently deleted, rather than moved to Deleted Items.

parameters.name: extension
parameters.description: Only necessary if changing the document's extension.  Do not include the leading period.

put.description: Update the content of a document

parameters.name: sanitizeName
parameters.description: If true, invalid characters in the name parameter are removed without an error being returned.

parameters.name: parent
parameters.description: 12-digit ID or EnvID of the new folder’s parent container.

parameters.name: cabinet
parameters.description: (It starts with NG-) Can be omitted if a folder or workspace id is specified in the parent.

parameters.name: $select
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of attribute values. See the REST API documentation for more details.

200.description: List of subfolders and documents in the folder

get.description: Retrieve the contents of a folder, including documents and subfolders

post.summary: File or unfile document to folder
post.description: File an item in a folder or unfile an item from a folder.

parameters.name: permanent
parameters.description: Indicates that the folder should be permanently deleted, rather than moved to Deleted Items. The contents of the folder, including descendant subfolders, will not be permanently deleted.

parameters.name: deleteContents
parameters.description: Indicates that the documents in the deleted folder (and in any descendant subfolder) should be deleted also, rather than simply unfiled.

parameters.name: recipients
parameters.description: One or more valid email addresses separated by semi-colons.  Duplicates ignored.

parameters.name: send
parameters.description: Which category of users should receive the alert.

post.description: Receive alerts when new content is added to a folder
Receive alerts when the document is updated

parameters.name: recipients
parameters.description: One or more valid email addresses separated by semi-colons.  Duplicates ignored.

parameters.name: send
parameters.description: Which category of users should receive the alert.

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: Use the same format and operators as in the NetDocuments web interface.

parameters.name: $top
parameters.description: An integer between 1 and 500.  Default is 100.

parameters.name: $select
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of attribute values.  See the REST API documentation for more details.

200.description: List of documents matching the search criteria

get.description: Get info about current user, ID isn't required

parameters.name: extension
parameters.description: Do not include the leading period.

parameters.name: addToRecent
parameters.description: Add to the user's recent documents list.

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: Specifies which version’s content should be downloaded.  Defaults to the official version.

parameters.name: destination
parameters.description: The 12-digit ID or EnvID of the folder, filter or workspace.

parameters.name: file
parameters.description: Put the filename plus extension in the accompanying filename field.

parameters.name: password
parameters.description: Depending on the cabinet configuration, the password may be optional or mandatory.

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: Which version of the document to share.  If empty, the official version will be shared.

parameters.name: download
parameters.description: If true, the document may be downloaded by the recipient.

parameters.name: notifyme
parameters.description: If true, notify the sender when the secured link is accessed.

parameters.name: lock
parameters.description: Optionally, lock the selected version of the document.  This requires Edit rights.

post.description: Generate a link to a document that can be accessed by anyone

get.description: Retrieve a list of actions taken on a document

get.summary: Get or create a workspace (with parent and child attributes)
get.description: Get or create a workspace (with parent and child attributes)

parameters.name: parentID
parameters.description: The parent value used to define workspaces in the cabinet.

parameters.name: childID
parameters.description: The child value used to define workspaces in the cabinet.

get.summary: Get or create a workspace (with a single attribute)
get.description: Get or create a workspace (with a single attribute)

parameters.name: parentID
parameters.description: The sole value used to define workspaces in the cabinet.

put.summary: Create or update a child lookup table entry
put.description: Create or update a child lookup table entry

get.summary: Get a child lookup table entry
get.description: Get a child lookup table entry

delete.summary: Delete a child lookup table entry
delete.description: Delete a child lookup table entry

put.summary: Create or update a lookup table entry
put.description: Create or update a lookup table entry

get.summary: Get a lookup table entry or search for child table entries
get.description: Get a lookup table entry or search for child table entries

parameters.name: attributeID
parameters.description: (Remove the leading '10'.  To return a single value, enter the parent attribute ID, or to search for child entries, enter the child attribute ID.)

parameters.name: parentID
parameters.description: (To return a single value, enter the key of the single attribute, or to search for child entries enter the key of the parent.)

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: (See the documentation for the available filters)

parameters.name: $skip
parameters.x-ms-summary: Number of matching records to skip
parameters.description: (This is used when retrieving multiple blocks of results.)

parameters.name: $top
parameters.x-ms-summary: Maximum number of records to return
parameters.description: Maximum number of records to return

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: (See the documentation for the available filters)

parameters.name: $skip
parameters.x-ms-summary: Number of matching records to skip
parameters.description: (This is used when retrieving multiple blocks of results.)

parameters.name: $top
parameters.x-ms-summary: Maximum number of records to return
parameters.description: Maximum number of records to return

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: (Review the documentation for the query format)

parameters.name: select
parameters.description: (Review the documentation for the return format)

parameters.name: top
parameters.x-ms-summary: Number of results to return (defaults to 50)

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: (Defaults to 30 days; format yyyy-MM-dd or yyyy-MM-ddThh:mm:ssZ)

parameters.name: end
parameters.description: (Same format as start; defaults to today)

parameters.name: paging
parameters.description: (Return the results in pages; default is false)

parameters.name: $skiptoken
parameters.description: (For paging purposes; returned by prior calls as 'next')

parameters.name: returnInfo
parameters.description: all will return group names. Default is blank to return just IDs

post.description: Create a user in a repository

parameters.name: username
parameters.description: (The same as the user's email address)

post.summary: Add user to or remove user from repository
post.description: Add user to or remove user from repository

get.summary: Get unhidden cabinet groups access rights
get.description: Get unhidden cabinet groups access rights

post.summary: Add to or remove group from cabinet
post.description: Add group to cabinet and default access rights

parameters.name: noAccess
parameters.description: No access rights (N) - Only for add.

get.description: Get all of the groups added to a cabinet

parameters.name: topwsattributegroupkey
parameters.description: (For regular cabinet external groups; to associate the group with a specific top workspace attribute value)

post.summary: Search a cabinet and modify ACLs
post.description: Search a cabinet and modify ACLs

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: (Review the documentation for the query format)

parameters.name: newAcl
parameters.description: (Review the documentation for the proper json format)

parameters.name: completionEmail
parameters.description: (true = send always (default), false = don't send, fail = send only on fail)

get.description: Get the contents of the selected container

parameters.name: select
parameters.description: (Review the documentation for the return format)

parameters.name: top
parameters.x-ms-summary: Number of results to return (defaults to 50)

parameters.name: cabMembership
parameters.description: (If set to 'true' the cabinets this groups is a member of and the default document access rights for each cabinet will be included.)

parameters.name: member
parameters.description: (Must be a member of the repository already.)

closed.description: Format '/Date(Number of Millis From Jan 1, 1970+-UTC', like: '/Date(1582261200000-0500)/'
